body.p: Ohio-born, Kentucky lawyer, businessman, and politician. Married to Louisiana “Anna” Hooper Jackson. Father of nine children. Member of the Republican Party. Studied law with Benjamin Harrison in the law offices of Bellamy Storer. Member of the Kentucky Town Ball Club in the Ohio River Valley. Served as a lieutenant colonel in the Twenty-third Kentucky Infantry Regiment during the Civil War. Also served under Ulysses S. Grant and Henry W. Halleck. Canvassed on behalf of Abraham Lincoln in the 1864 Presidential Election. Served as a presidential elector for the Lincoln-Johnson ticket in 1864. Represented Newport, Kentucky, as a member of the Union Executive Committee of Kentucky in 1865.
